14/*!
15 * \file isc/hmac.h
16 * \brief This is the header for for message authentication code.
17 */
18
19#pragma once
20
21#include <isc/lang.h>
22#include <isc/md.h>
23#include <isc/platform.h>
24#include <isc/types.h>
25#include <isc/result.h>
26
27#include <openssl/hmac.h>
28
29typedef HMAC_CTX isc_hmac_t;
30
31/**
32 * isc_hmac:
33 * @type: the digest type
34 * @key: the key
35 * @keylen: the length of the key
36 * @buf: data to hash
37 * @len: length of the data to hash
38 * @digest: the output buffer
39 * @digestlen: the length of the data written to @digest
40 *
41 * This function computes the message authentication code using a digest type
42 * @type with key @key which is @keylen bytes long from data in @buf which is
43 * @len bytes long, and places the output into @digest, which must have space
44 * for the hash function output (use ISC_MAX_MD_SIZE if unsure). If the
45 * @digestlen parameter is not NULL then the number of bytes of data written
46 * (i.e. the length of the digest) will be written to the @digestlen.
47 */
48isc_result_t
49isc_hmac(isc_md_type_t type, const void *key, const int keylen,
50 const unsigned char *buf, const size_t len,
51 unsigned char *digest, unsigned int *digestlen);
52
53/**
54 * isc_hmac_new:
55 *
56 * This function allocates, initializes and returns HMAC context.
57 */
58isc_hmac_t *
59isc_hmac_new(void);
60
61/**
62 * isc_hmac_free:
63 * @md: HMAC context
64 *
65 * This function cleans up HMAC context and frees up the space allocated to it.
66 */
67void
68isc_hmac_free(isc_hmac_t *hmac);
69
70/**
71 * isc_hmac_init:
72 * @md: HMAC context
73 * @key: HMAC key
74 * @keylen: HMAC key length
75 * @type: digest type
76 *
77 * This function sets up HMAC context to use a hash function of @type and key
78 * @key which is @keylen bytes long.
79 */
80
81isc_result_t
82isc_hmac_init(isc_hmac_t *hmac, const void *key,
83 size_t keylen, isc_md_type_t type);
84
85/**
86 * isc_hmac_reset:
87 * @hmac: HMAC context
88 *
89 * This function resets the HMAC context. This can be used to reuse an already
90 * existing context.
91 */
92isc_result_t
93isc_hmac_reset(isc_hmac_t *hmac);
94
95/**
96 * isc_hmac_update:
97 * @hmac: HMAC context
98 * @buf: data to hash
99 * @len: length of the data to hash
100 *
101 * This function can be called repeatedly with chunks of the message @buf to be
102 * authenticated which is @len bytes long.
103 */
104isc_result_t
105isc_hmac_update(isc_hmac_t *hmac, const unsigned char *buf, const size_t len);
106
107/**
108 * isc_hmac_final:
109 * @hmac: HMAC context
110 * @digest: the output buffer
111 * @digestlen: the lenth of the data written to @digest
112 *
113 * This function retrieves the message authentication code from @hmac and places
114 * it in @digest, which must have space for the hash function output. If the
115 * @digestlen parameter is not NULL then the number of bytes of data written
116 * (i.e. the length of the digest) will be written to the @digestlen. After
117 * calling this function no additional calls to isc_hmac_update() can be made.
118 */
119isc_result_t
120isc_hmac_final(isc_hmac_t *hmac, unsigned char *digest,
121 unsigned int *digestlen);
122
123/**
124 * isc_hmac_md_type:
125 * @hmac: HMAC context
126 *
127 * This function return the isc_md_type_t previously set for the supplied
128 * HMAC context or NULL if no isc_md_type_t has been set.
129 */
130isc_md_type_t
131isc_hmac_get_md_type(isc_hmac_t *hmac);
132
133/**
134 * isc_hmac_get_size:
135 *
136 * This function return the size of the message digest when passed an isc_hmac_t
137 * structure, i.e. the size of the hash.
138 */
139size_t
140isc_hmac_get_size(isc_hmac_t *hmac);
141
142/**
143 * isc_hmac_get_block_size:
144 *
145 * This function return the block size of the message digest when passed an
146 * isc_hmac_t structure.
147 */
148int
149isc_hmac_get_block_size(isc_hmac_t *hmac);
150
